videos.title: Victoria Monet - Alright (2024)
videos.description: The music video for "Alright" by Victoria Monét, directed by Dave Meyers, is a vibrant homage to Janet Jackson, featuring high-energy choreography and striking visuals. In the video, Monét channels Jackson's iconic style, wearing a black-and-white fedora and suit, and performing dynamic dance routines reminiscent of Jackson's 1990s and 2000s era. The video, choreographed by Sean Bankhead, showcases Monét's impressive dance skills and captures the essence of liberation and celebration. Made in collaboration with Jacobi Mehringer, Anna Arnell, and Mia Barnes.
videos.additional_info:
Victoria Monet - Alright (2024)
The music video for "Alright" by Victoria Monét, directed by Dave Meyers, is a vibrant homage to Janet Jackson, featuring high-energy choreography and striking visuals. In the video, Monét channels Jackson's iconic style, wearing a black-and-white fedora and suit, and performing dynamic dance routines reminiscent of Jackson's 1990s and 2000s era. The video, choreographed by Sean Bankhead, showcases Monét's impressive dance skills and captures the essence of liberation and celebration. Made in collaboration with Jacobi Mehringer, Anna Arnell, and Mia Barnes.
Technique - Choreo , Match Cut
Director - Dave Meyers
DOP - Scott Cunningham
Editor - Vinnie Hobbs
Colorist - Dante Pasquinelli
Original Source - Link

videos.title: Sam Akpro - Death By Entertainment (2023)
videos.description: The music video for "Death By Entertainment" by Sam Akpro, directed by Pedro Takahashi, presents the artist and his band as Wall Street-style bankers caught in an endless loop of hard work and intense leisure. The video employs split screens and dynamic camera movements to convey a melancholic yet captivating atmosphere, mirroring the song's themes of repetitive daily life and the blurring lines between day and night due to physical and mental exhaustion.
videos.additional_info:
Sam Akpro - Death By Entertainment (2023)
The music video for "Death By Entertainment" by Sam Akpro, directed by Pedro Takahashi, presents the artist and his band as Wall Street-style bankers caught in an endless loop of hard work and intense leisure. The video employs split screens and dynamic camera movements to convey a melancholic yet captivating atmosphere, mirroring the song's themes of repetitive daily life and the blurring lines between day and night due to physical and mental exhaustion.
Technique - Match Cut
Director - Pedro Takahashi
DOP - Max Conran
Colorist - Connor Coolbear, Electric Theatre Collective

videos.title: Watchtower of Turkey (2014)
videos.description: Described as a visual masterpiece, "Watchtower of Turkey" is praised for its breathtaking cinematography, dynamic soundtrack, and impeccable editing. The film takes viewers through vibrant cities and awe-inspiring landscapes, showcasing the country's remarkable diversity and beauty. It's more than just a travel video; it's a tribute to Turkey's rich culture, history, and natural wonders, crafted with an eye for detail and a knack for storytelling.

videos.description: Dillon Francis, Good Times Ahead - LA On Acid (2023)
videos.additional_info:
Dillon Francis, Good Times Ahead - LA On Acid (2023)
A mesmerizing music video featuring a chaotic journey initiated by Diplo's spiked chicken nugget, showcasing wild camera angles, unusual characters, and intense visual effects set in a quirky vintage Chinese restaurant. Director Seaman's close collaboration with Francis ensures a deep connection with the song's rhythms and lyrics, bringing to life a vividly demented world that captivates viewers, with or without the influence of LSD.
Technique - Dutch Angle , Match Cut
Director - Parker Seaman
DOP - Franklin Ricart
Editor - Jacob Ehrlich
Colorist - Josh Bohoskey

videos.title: Watchtower of Turkey (2014)
videos.description: Described as a visual masterpiece, "Watchtower of Turkey" is praised for its breathtaking cinematography, dynamic soundtrack, and impeccable editing. The film takes viewers through vibrant cities and awe-inspiring landscapes, showcasing the country's remarkable diversity and beauty. It's more than just a travel video; it's a tribute to Turkey's rich culture, history, and natural wonders, crafted with an eye for detail and a knack for storytelling.
videos.additional_info:
Watchtower of Turkey (2014)
Described as a visual masterpiece, "Watchtower of Turkey" is praised for its breathtaking cinematography, dynamic soundtrack, and impeccable editing. The film takes viewers through vibrant cities and awe-inspiring landscapes, showcasing the country's remarkable diversity and beauty. It's more than just a travel video; it's a tribute to Turkey's rich culture, history, and natural wonders, crafted with an eye for detail and a knack for storytelling.
Technique - Match Cut
Director - Leonardo Dalessandri

videos.alt_text: Pa Salieu - My Family feat BackRoad Gee
videos.title: Pa Salieu - My Family feat BackRoad Gee (2020)
videos.additional_info:
Pa Salieu - My Family feat BackRoad Gee (2020)
Music video for British rapper Pa Salieu, from director Femi Ladi. Utilizes a bolt arm camera that was popularized in Kendrick Lamar's 2017 music video, Humble, by director Dave Meyers. Ladi's decision to use a black and white color scheme gives this film an interesting juxtaposition between a timeless look, and modern camera techniques, with the help of the bolt arm.
Technique - Camera Roll , Match Cut
Director - Femi Ladi
DOP - Stefan Yap
Original Source - Link
BLACK AND WHITE

videos.title: Watchtower of China (2022)
videos.description: A cinematic exploration capturing the vast diversity and spirit of China through seamless edits and fluid camera work over five years of filming and editing. The project, which extends Dalessandri's unique visual storytelling seen in "Watchtower of Turkey," presents a rich tapestry of China's landscapes, people, and culture, set to the emotive compositions of Ezio Bosso. The film is acclaimed for its vibrant portrayal and deep personal vision of China, reflecting the interconnected energy of its inhabitants and their surroundings.
videos.additional_info:
Watchtower of China (2022)
A cinematic exploration capturing the vast diversity and spirit of China through seamless edits and fluid camera work over five years of filming and editing. The project, which extends Dalessandri's unique visual storytelling seen in "Watchtower of Turkey," presents a rich tapestry of China's landscapes, people, and culture, set to the emotive compositions of Ezio Bosso. The film is acclaimed for its vibrant portrayal and deep personal vision of China, reflecting the interconnected energy of its inhabitants and their surroundings.
Technique - Match Cut , Match motion
Director - Leonardo Dalessandri
Original Source - Link

videos.title: M.I.A. 'Bad Girls' (2012)
videos.description: M.I.A.'s "Bad Girls" music video is a visually stunning showcase of Saudi-inspired car stunts, with drifting vehicles on two wheels and empowered women in a desert setting, blending Middle Eastern cultural elements with modern rebellion. Directed by Romain Gavras, the video highlights themes of female empowerment and defiance, all set against a backdrop of high-octane action and surreal imagery.

videos.title: Flume feat. MAY-A - Say Nothing (2022)
videos.description: The music video for "Say Nothing" by Flume featuring MAY-A, directed by Michael Hili, offers a visually captivating and surreal experience. It includes psychedelic visuals, with Flume donning a bleach-blonde hairstyle and posing on motorcycles, while MAY-A is seen submerged in black sand. The video uses stark contrasts and vibrant colors to complement the song's themes of post-relationship clarity and emotional expression. This trippy and avant-garde style enhances the song's narrative, making it a standout piece in Flume's discography.
videos.additional_info:
Flume feat. MAY-A - Say Nothing (2022)
The music video for "Say Nothing" by Flume featuring MAY-A, directed by Michael Hili, offers a visually captivating and surreal experience. It includes psychedelic visuals, with Flume donning a bleach-blonde hairstyle and posing on motorcycles, while MAY-A is seen submerged in black sand. The video uses stark contrasts and vibrant colors to complement the song's themes of post-relationship clarity and emotional expression. This trippy and avant-garde style enhances the song's narrative, making it a standout piece in Flume's discography.
Technique - Central Framing , Match Cut , Tableau
Director - Michael Hili
DOP - Dimitri Zaunders, Kieran Fowler
Editor - Ian Wallace
Colorist - Josh Bohoskey

videos.title: Jhula - Manish Khushalani (2024)
videos.description: The music video for "Jhula" by Manish Khushalani, released in 2024, explores themes of vulnerability, trust, and the delicate nature of relationships. The video combines Indian classical elements with contemporary electronic music, creating a unique visual and auditory experience. The narrative is driven by a series of intimate and evocative scenes that reflect the song's emotional depth, showcasing a blend of traditional and modern aesthetics that highlight the fusion of cultural influences. The visuals are crafted to complement the haunting melody and poignant lyrics, making for a captivating and immersive experience.
videos.additional_info:
Jhula - Manish Khushalani (2024)
The music video for "Jhula" by Manish Khushalani, released in 2024, explores themes of vulnerability, trust, and the delicate nature of relationships. The video combines Indian classical elements with contemporary electronic music, creating a unique visual and auditory experience. The narrative is driven by a series of intimate and evocative scenes that reflect the song's emotional depth, showcasing a blend of traditional and modern aesthetics that highlight the fusion of cultural influences. The visuals are crafted to complement the haunting melody and poignant lyrics, making for a captivating and immersive experience.
Technique - Levitation , Match Cut , Overhead , Two Shot
Director - Manish Khushalani
Editor - Manish Khushalani
Colorist - Vineesh Vijayan
